net.cloud.client.logging

Class LoggerService

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.cloud.client.logging.LoggerService
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class LoggerService
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    The runnable service which holds a queue of LogReports to be processed and saved to file.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private boolean accepting
      Flag as to whether the service is still accepting reports or not
      private java.util.Optional<java.io.PrintWriter> logFile
      Since the log file may not have opened, keep it in an Optional
      private java.io.PrintWriter logWriter
      This PrintWriter will write to the console and log file
      private java.util.Queue<LogReport> reportQueue
      Queue of all reports waiting to be written to file
      private boolean running
      Flag as to whether the service is running or not.
      private LogWriterSet writerSet
      A set of PrintWriters for the different LogSection files

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LoggerService()
      Default constructor.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private void flushStdOutFile()
      If the log file was successfully opened, flush any pending writes to the file.
      java.io.PrintWriter getLogWriter()
      Obtain a Writer which can be used to print to both standard output as well as a log file for standard output.
      private void initLogFile()
      Initialize the log file for writing a log of standard output If the file cannot be opened, an error message will be printed and the Optional will be empty
      private void initLogWriter()
      Initialize the Writer which will write through to both standard output and the log file.
      private void processQueue()
      For every LogReport currently queued, remove if from the queue and have it save itself to the correct log file.
      void run()
      This method will loop for as long as the service is running.
      void stop()
      Tell this service that it should stop.
      void submit(LogReport report)
      Submit a report so that it will be saved to file on the next cycle of the service.
      private void updateRunningFlag()
      Check to see if the loop should continue running.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • reportQueue

        private java.util.Queue<LogReport> reportQueue
        Queue of all reports waiting to be written to file

      • writerSet

        private LogWriterSet writerSet
        A set of PrintWriters for the different LogSection files

      • logFile

        private java.util.Optional<java.io.PrintWriter> logFile
        Since the log file may not have opened, keep it in an Optional

      • logWriter

        private java.io.PrintWriter logWriter
        This PrintWriter will write to the console and log file

      • running

        private volatile boolean running
        Flag as to whether the service is running or not. (will not even save reports)

      • accepting

        private volatile boolean accepting
        Flag as to whether the service is still accepting reports or not

    • Constructor Detail

      • LoggerService

        public LoggerService()
        Default constructor. Intended to be used by the Logger class - not directly

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        This method will loop for as long as the service is running. Each cycle of it will save all pending file changes
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • submit

        public void submit(LogReport report)
        Submit a report so that it will be saved to file on the next cycle of the service. Thread-safe and non-blocking. Thanks Java Concurrent API!
        This will not throw an exception or anything if reports are not being accepted. It'd be out of the hands of the caller anyways.
        Parameters:
        report - The report which should be saved away

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Tell this service that it should stop. This will cause it to stop accepting more reports, however it will continue until all currently queued reports have been saved.

      • getLogWriter

        public java.io.PrintWriter getLogWriter()
        Obtain a Writer which can be used to print to both standard output as well as a log file for standard output.
        Returns:
        A PrintWriter to both standard out and its log file

      • initLogFile

        private void initLogFile()
        Initialize the log file for writing a log of standard output If the file cannot be opened, an error message will be printed and the Optional will be empty

      • initLogWriter

        private void initLogWriter()
        Initialize the Writer which will write through to both standard output and the log file. (This writer will only go to standard out if the file isn't open)

      • processQueue

        private void processQueue()
        For every LogReport currently queued, remove if from the queue and have it save itself to the correct log file.

      • updateRunningFlag

        private void updateRunningFlag()
        Check to see if the loop should continue running. If not, the running flag will be set to false

      • flushStdOutFile

        private void flushStdOutFile()
        If the log file was successfully opened, flush any pending writes to the file.
